definitions.definition: An aromatic hydrocarbon of formula C 6 H 6 whose structure consists of a ring of alternate single and double bonds .
Sometimes used in place of the phenyl group.

main_definition: ( organic chemistry ) An aromatic hydrocarbon of formula C 6 H 6 whose structure consists of a ring of alternate single and double bonds .
secondary_definitions: ( organic chemistry , in combination ) Sometimes used in place of the phenyl group.
